titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices and Council, A proclamation. Sydney, Tho: Coningesby. Whereas there is good reason to suspect, that several dangerous persons coming as spies from the rebels, and upon other wicked designs, are sheltred in the city of Dublin, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook assignee of Benjamin Tooke printer to the King and Queen at Their Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
"Given at The Council-Chamber in Dublin, the 12th day of December, 1690.".
No Papists to sell any wine, ale, beer, &c. in Dublin.--Steele.
Steele notation: Arms 193. several good without.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
